channel.title: Finance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from Finance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Deloitte’s CTO on a stunning AI transformation stat: companies are spending 93% on tech and only 7% on people
item.description: Bill Briggs recognizes an old inertia inside the boardroom: "I felt it in my travels, but I hadn't been able to quantify it."

item.title: Critical Amazon Kindle Hack Confirmed — What You Need To Know
item.description: A hacker found a way to access Amazon accounts using a malicious book downloaded to a Kindle. What you need to know about the ebook attack.

item.title: Healthcare In 2025: A Year Of Chaos, Confusion — But Little Improvement
item.description: A yearlong pattern of intense disruption followed by little improvement played out across nearly every major healthcare storyline in 2025.

item.title: Making nightmares into reality: AI finds fans in the Islamic State, other militant and terrorist other groups worldwide
item.description: “One of the best things about AI is how easy it is to use,” said someone on a pro-IS site last month.

item.title: Italian cuisine, and even the rituals surrounding it, get an official UNESCO world heritage designation
item.description: “This tradition of being at the table, of stopping for a while at lunch, a bit longer at dinner ... it’s not very common around the world."

item.title: Fed chair favorite Kevin Hassett on potential independence from Trump: ‘His opinion matters if it’s good, if it’s based on data’
item.description: On Friday, Trump said he “certainly should have a role" in Fed policy. "I’ve done great. I’ve made a lot of money ... I think my voice should be heard...

item.title: Faster Typing Is Just A Case Of Splitting Your Keyboard In Two Like The Elytra From Elim
item.description: This Elytra keyboard from Elim forces the user to adopt a better typing postion and stops the hands crossing over by splitting the keyboard into two h...

item.title: Rob Reiner, comedy legend who directed ‘When Harry Met Sally’ and ‘Spinal Tap,’ dead at 78
item.description: Reiner and his wife, Michele Singer, were found dead Sunday at their home in the Brentwood neighborhood of Los Angeles.

item.title: If Telegram Is On Your iPhone Or Android Phone, Secure Your Account Now
item.description: Do not lose your account — make this change today.

item.title: New Technique Of Selective Gradient Masking Localizes Suspected Harmful AI-Based Mental Health Knowledge And Renders It Expungable
item.description: AI can give out bad mental health advice. This can occur due to initial training. A new technique uses knowledge localization to flag and remove it. A...

item.title: Roomba maker iRobot files for bankruptcy, will go private
Stocks risk a stir-up in last trading push of the year. Where to put your money.

item.description: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said American households could receive substantial $1,000-$2,000 tax refunds in early 2026 under OBBBA tax law change...

item.title: Powell says he wants to 'turn this job over' with economy in 'really good shape' before departure
item.description: Federal Reserve chair Jerome Powell wants to leave office with inflation at 2% and strong job market when his term ends in May 2026, avoiding legacy t...

item.title: U.S. stock futures little changed ahead of year’s last full week of trading

item.title: Powell says rate cuts won't make 'much of a difference' for struggling housing sector
item.description: Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell warned that housing market struggles will persist despite rate cuts, citing low inventory and affordability cha...

item.title: Mortgage rates tick higher but remain near 2025 lows
item.description: The average rate on a 30-year fixed mortgage rose this week to 6.22%, according to the latest Freddie Mac data released on Thursday. That is up from l...

item.title: Silicon Valley Is Raving About a Made-in-China AI Model
item.description: DeepSeek is called “amazing and impressive” despite working with less-advanced chips.

item.title: What to Know About China's DeepSeek AI
item.description: The Chinese upstart says it has trained high-performing AI models cheaply, without using the most advanced chips.

item.title: Tech, Media & Telecom Roundup: Market Talk

item.title: Reid Hoffman Raises $24.6 Million for AI Cancer-Research Startup
item.description: The LinkedIn co-founder is starting Manas AI with “The Emperor of All Maladies” author Siddhartha Mukherjee.

item.title: Can an App Replace a Personal Trainer? I Tested Nearly a Dozen to Find Out
item.description: Apps can add flexibility and freshness to your routine. Just try not to get injured.
